akn:content.akn:p: § 46a. Employment of aliens by Secretary The Secretary of the Smithsonian Institution, subject to adequate security and other investigations as he may determine to be appropriate, and subject further to a prior determination by him that no qualified United States citizen is available for the particular position involved, is authorized to employ and compensate aliens in a scientific or technical capacity at authorized rates of compensation without regard to statutory provisions prohibiting payment of compensation to aliens. (Pub. L. 88–549, Aug. 31, 1964, 78 Stat. 754.)
